# Hamse Warfa

Hamse Warfa is a Somali-American politician, author, speaker, and social entrepreneur his journey from a child refugee to a U.S. presidential appointee has inspired many. With over 25 years of leadership experience across federal and state governments, philanthropy, nonprofits, and the private sector, Warfa was known for his transformative work in advancing inclusive democracy, workforce development, and economic inclusion. He currently serves as the Chief Executive Officer of World Savvy, a national education nonprofit focused on transforming K-12 education to prepare students for a diverse, interconnected world.
Early life and education
Hamse Warfa was born in Mogadishu, Somalia, where he spent the first decade of his life in an affluent suburb and enjoying a vibrant childhood filled with soccer and beach outings. His parents, Mohamed and Hindisa Warfa, were successful entrepreneurs, with his father working as a livestock trader and his mother running a clothing store. After outbreak of the Somali Civil War in 1991 disrupted this idyllic life, Warfa and his family of 14 to flee to Kenya. They spent three and a half years in the Otanga and Dadaab refugee camps, where Warfa experienced the challenges of displacement, reduced to a registration number with no formal economic and social identity.
In 1994, Warfa and his family were resettled in the United States, initially in Colorado, before moving to San Diego's City Heights neighborhood. Navigating a new country with limited resources and language barriers, Warfa learned to advocate for his family, engaging with social services and community organizations. He earned a Bachelor of Arts in Political Science from San Diego State University and later a Master of Science in Organizational Management and Leadership from Springfield College in Massachusetts. Warfa furthered his education through the Young American Leaders Program at Harvard Business School, enhancing his expertise in leadership and innovation.
Career
Warfa's career spans multiple sectors, reflecting his commitment to bridging divides and creating opportunities for marginalized communities. His work is driven by a mission to translate societal challenges into tangible solutions through leadership strategy, innovative technology, and inclusive policies.
Public sector leadership
In April 2019, Warfa was appointed Deputy Commissioner for Workforce Development at the Minnesota Department of Employment and Economic Development (DEED) by Governor Tim Walz, becoming the highest-ranking African immigrant official in Minnesota's executive branch. In this role, he oversaw employment and training programs, Minnesota's 51 job centers, the Office of Economic Opportunity, and the Office of Immigrant and Refugee Affairs. During the COVID-19 pandemic, Warfa spearheaded initiatives to address economic disparities, securing $60 million in grant funding for small businesses and launching the Office of Immigrant and Refugee Affairs to support Minnesota's growing immigrant workforce.
In January 2022, Warfa made history as the first Somali-American presidential appointee in U.S. history, joining the Biden administration as a Senior Advisor in the U.S. State Department's Office of the Under Secretary for Civilian Security, Democracy, and Human Rights. He played a pivotal role in advancing the global democracy agenda, supporting the 2023 Summit on Democracy with participation from 74 nations. His innovative contributions earned him a 2023 State Department Meritorious Honor Award for advancing equity and inclusion.
Social entrepreneurship
Warfa is a serial entrepreneur with a focus on economic inclusion and social impact. In 2016, he co-founded BanQu Inc., a blockchain-powered software company aimed at eradicating extreme poverty by providing unbanked populations, particularly refugees, with secure, portable digital economic identities. Recognized with an Innovation Award by the Obama Administration and MIT, BanQu enables individuals to document their financial, educational, and social transactions, fostering dignity and access to global markets. Warfa's work with BanQu addresses the exclusion of 2.5 billion people from the global economic ecosystem, a challenge he experienced firsthand as a refugee.[](https://www.bushfoundation.org/people/hamse-warfa/)[](https://www.pbs.org/newshour/brief/259073/hamse-warfa)[](https://www.ashoka.org/en-us/fellow/hamse-warfa)
Warfa also founded Tayo Consulting Group, which supports philanthropic organizations in refining their goals and funding impactful programs. His earlier work in philanthropy included serving as a Senior Program Officer at the Margaret A. Cargill Foundation, where he led grantmaking for domestic and international Children & Families programs.[](https://www.hamsewarfa.com/about)[](https://hiiraan.com/news4/2020/Dec/180977/hamse_warfa_has_lived_the_immigrant_experience_now_in_charge_of_minnesota_s_employment_and_training_programs.aspx
Leadership in education
In September 2024, Warfa was appointed CEO of World Savvy, a national nonprofit dedicated to redefining K-12 education through global competence and civic engagement. Drawing on his experiences as a refugee student who struggled in U.S. public schools, Warfa is committed to expanding World Savvy's reach, particularly through its Thriving Democracy Initiative, which equips young people with critical thinking and perspective-taking skills for a diverse world. His long-standing collaboration with World Savvy, spanning over a decade as a volunteer and fundraiser, positions him to build on the organization's legacy while advancing its mission.[](https://worldsavvy.org/world-savvy-announces-hamse-warfa-as-ceo/)[](https://worldsavvy.org/welcoming-hamse-warfa-as-our-new-ceo/
Authorship and advocacy
Warfa is the author of two acclaimed books: ''America Here I Come: A Somali Refugee's Quest for Hope ( støweb:7⁊), which chronicles his journey from Somalia to the U.S., and The Transformational Leader: Twelve Practices for Driving Lasting Change'' (2023), which outlines his leadership framework for creating impactful change. He is also producing an upcoming documentary film that further amplifies his story and mission. As a sought-after speaker, Warfa inspires audiences with insights on transformational leadership, cross-cultural understanding, and economic inclusion.()()
Warfa's advocacy extends to his role as a bridge-builder, addressing systemic disparities for communities of color and immigrants. His work has been recognized with numerous accolades, including the 2016 Bush Foundation Fellowship, the 2017 Minnesota Statewide Facing Race Award, and the Ashoka Global Fellowship for his social entrepreneurship.
Personal life
Warfa is a father of four and resides in Minneapolis, Minnesota, with his family. His experiences as a parent inform his passion for education reform, emphasizing the need for inclusive, future-ready learning environments. Warfa's journey from a refugee camp to global leadership reflects his belief in the power of resilience, education, and civic engagement. He remains deeply connected to Minnesota's Somali community and advocates for policies that uplift marginalized voices.[](https://worldsavvy.org/world-savvy-announces-hamse-warfa-as-ceo/)[](https://www.cbsnews.com/minnesota/news/hamse-warfa-appointed-to-state-department/)[](https://hiiraan.com/news4/2020/Dec/180977/hamse_warfa_has_lived_the_immigrant_experience_now_in_charge_of_minnesota_s_employment_and_training_programs.aspx
Hamse Warfa's career exemplifies the potential for individuals to transform adversity into opportunity. As a trailblazer in public service, entrepreneurship, and education, he has reshaped narratives around refugees, demonstrating their capacity for agency and economic contribution. His leadership at World Savvy and his ongoing work with BanQu continue to influence global and local systems, promoting equity, inclusion, and systemic change. Warfa's story serves as a beacon of hope, illustrating the value of every voice in a thriving democracy.[](https://www.cbsnews.com/minnesota/news/hamse-warfa-appointed-to-state-department/)[](https://www.pbs.org/newshour/brief/259073/hamse-warfa)
Awards and honors
* 2023: U.S. State Department Meritorious Honor Award for Innovation and Equity.
* 2017: Minnesota Statewide Facing Race Award.
* 2017: Ashoka Global Fellow for Social Entrepreneurship.
* 2016: Bush Foundation Fellow.
* Innovation Award from the Obama Administration and MIT (for BanQu).
Publications
* ''America Here I Come: A Somali Refugee's Quest for Hope (2014)
* The Transformational Leader: Twelve Practices for Driving Lasting Change'' (2023).
